Name: Section 1 Introduction Overview
Notes:
It says "A vital part of this system is a feature that allows instructors to set grades and give feedback on student work." 
I think it sounds better if you change 'a feature' to 'the feature'

Name: Section 2.4 - Wording change
Notes:
This one is a suggestion but for this line:
"No technical experience is required for the use of ezMarker."
Brown did mention to be more specific. No technical experience could mean something we really don't intend

Name: Section 1.2 - adding details
Notes:
"ezMarker also offers a more efficient way of manually marking students"
We need to provide an example or be more specific about how its more efficient for manual entry. 

"The goal of implementing a new system of feedback and grading is to improve the speed.."
I remember Brown talking about adding an actual time estimate, provide some sort of way to quantify this speed factor.

Name: Section 1 More detail
Notes:
Need to add detail as to exactly why existing MLS implementation sucks. Also mention building off of existing implementation. Also mention uploading files to set grades and feedback and allowing to set manually multiple students at once.

Also mention we are supporting manual input in 1.2

Also see the follow Slack exchange:
"Troy Nechanicky [6:40 PM] 
Req. introduction says "conventional feedback uploading techniques such as... through a Dropbox interface". Accurate? Could be better worded to expose problem with interface? (I'm already going to add that you have to manually enter grades for sometimes 200 students)


Harold [7:01 PM] 
Wording could use some help. If you check my report from last winter I go into the manual methods a bit"
